desc: BABAM1, a component of multiprotein complexes that have deubiquitinase activity, is altered by amplification in pancreatic, breast and ovarian cancers.
gene/name: BRISC and BRCA1 A complex member 1

desc: The BABAM1 gene encodes an important component of both the BRCA1-A and BRISC multiprotein complexes. The BRCA1-A complex recognizes lysine-63 ubiquitinated histones H2A and H2AX at DNA double strand break (DBS) sites, facilitating damage-dependent BRCA1 localization and DNA repair (PMID: 19261748). The BRISC complex cleaves lysine 63 ubiquitinated substrates, playing a role in interferon responses and proper mitotic spindle assembly (PMID: 24075985, 26195665). Both BRCA1-A and BRISC complexes have deubiquitinase activity. BABAM1 is typically altered by amplification, particularly in neuroendocrine pancreatic tumors, breast and ovarian cancers (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Nov 2016). Germline variants of BABAM1 have been reported to confer susceptibility to ovarian cancer (PMID: 20852633).
gene/name: BRISC and BRCA1 A complex member 1
articles/0/title: Common variants at 19p13 are associated with susceptibility to ovarian cancer.
articles/1/title: MERIT40 facilitates BRCA1 localization and DNA damage repair.
articles/2/title: The deubiquitinating enzyme complex BRISC is required for proper mitotic spindle assembly in mammalian cells.
articles/3/title: A BRISC-SHMT complex deubiquitinates IFNAR1 and regulates interferon responses.
